poem:
Title: "A Morning Commence"

In this curious ballet of politics, morning's veil unfurls,
Sunak and Starmer take the stage, campaign banners unfurled.
False starts and rumours swirl, like leaves on a gusty day,
While beneath the din and spectacle, the true game is underway.
Oh, the delicious stumble, speculation more wild,
As parties dance to the drumbeat of promises reviled.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Friday briefing: Breaking down the big issues as the election campaign kicks off Good morning. It’s all kicked off. After a series of false starts and swirling rumours, Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer have finally started their election campaigns, though it has felt like both parties have been unofficially campaigning for a while now. It is easy – and, let’s be honest, really fun – to focus on the embarrassing fumbles and wild speculation about". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
